reviews.text: Stayed at the Intercon with a few friends. It was a quality hotel and the location was decent. It was about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station. Which wasn't bad. We used the Metro daily. Don't get this Intercon confused with the other fancy one. If you're into an awesome pool and spa, you should stay at the other one. If you can afford it, upgrade to the awesome Harbor View. Absolutely worth it. It just made the room a gazillion times better and feel like you're really in Hong Kong. My other friends got a room without the view and it just wasn't the same.

reviews.text: We wanted to stay in Kowloon and have a harbour view at a reasonable price. The Intercontinental Stanford was perfect. Price right, great location and top hotel. Arriving at 8:00am without prebooking the night before we thought may be a problem but we were given a harbourview room immediately and a late check out the next day no charge. The room was everything you would expect in a 5 star hotel. Unfortunately the restaurant was under renovation but nearby there were excellent restaurants. Location is perfect without being in crowded streets. Only 10 minutes walk to Nathan Rd and the Star Ferry. We will certainly stay at this hotel next time in Hong Kong.

reviews.text: The hotel is a standard business hotel, slightly disappointing as I had expected higher standards of a sister hotel of the famed Intercontinental Hong Kong down the road. The lobby is quite small and doesn't have any hint of a sea view. The rooms are smallish with a normal bathroom with tub-shower combination. We had booked the base "Garden View" room which I didn't realize actually looked on to an interior courtyard with some kind of garden, and a wall on the other side. Which means you don't get to see the city or anything. At least this area has a skylight so you know if it's day or night!
reviews.title: Good 4 star hotel, nice location, nothing special

reviews.text: Other than this weird aspect, the room was pretty standard. Internet was expensive at 60 HKD/hr or 120/day. The Tsim Sha Tsui subway and Nathan Road are a good 10 min walk, and the Star Ferry is 20 mins away, but it is a pleasant walk along the TST promenade or along a bunch of nice restaurants and cafes along the road. We stayed on a room-only rate, so we ended up having breakfast at the Delifrance a block away. It is a good area and I'd rather stay there than bang on Nathan Road, but a better view would have made all the difference. Considering the hotel was quite empty (Chinese New Year period), I would have expected them to heed my complaint on the view and at least upgrade me to a city view room!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a tourist area which means the concierge is very important. During my stay I never received good information or clear direction from the concierge. There was a big red bus outside the hotel. iIasked the Concierge if this bus had english tours or recordings. he said that it only had Japanese. He then sent me over to the tour desk which told me the same thing. Later I stopped by the big red bus and they definitely have english tours/recordings. The tour desk also is run by an outside company (inidcated by a very small sign). The concierge fed me this bull so i would use the in house tour desk. I don't like being lied to by the concierge. i then asked for restaurant suggestions later that day and was told to the restaurant next to the hotel. I gave up trying to find the place when there was nothing next to the hotel. Management needs to reevaluate the concierge desk.

reviews.text: I have only checked out of the Grand Stamford in the last 4 hours and I have to take the time to write this review (something I very rarely do... With the extent that I travel I usually don't bother). I left the GS to move to a hotel near the airport for an early flight tomorrow. I had forgotten my iPad. When I got to my room at the Next hotel (about 1hr later) I started searching briefcase, suitcase pocket and just as I was going into panic mode - a knock on my room door with a hand delivered message to "call Mr.Ivan at the GS about a lost item". First credit goes to the honesty of the staff. Next to mgmt - they actually tracked me down from taxi the concierge had given the driver. I called and Mr. Ivan on-duty mgr sent a hotel staff member to my current hotel (about a 40min taxi ride) with my iPad - I paid the round trip taxi fair a small price to have my iPad before I fly out tomorrow.

reviews.text: I have been in this hotel several times before and every time I like to go to other hotels in the area, I found it very hard to compare. Here the rate is very reasonable in terms of Hong Kong crazy overpriced hotel rates. Location is a bit negative if you are in Hong Kong for shopping and specially if you want to be near Nathan Road as you have to walk 15 minutes to get there or try the Holiday Inn Golden Mile which has the best location but not the best rooms. As far as rooms are concerned, they are beautiful and nicely decorated and bathrooms are full of nice amenities.You can get harbour view room at this property which should be nice. Breakfast is not fantastic but still good, and if you think it doesn't worth to pay around US$ 30 for breakfast, then I advise you to take your breakfast at DeliFrance or Starbucks just steps away. All in all the hotel is nice and would recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Try to use the Airport Express to the city when you get to Hong Kong as they give you free shuttle to all hotels from the station.

reviews.text: We had a long weekend in Hong Kong so looked for a hotel that had a harbour view, good location to transport networks and decent room service. The room service is essential for us as we travel with a five month old and struggle to eat out at night. Check in was efficient and straight forward. We were taken to our room and a travel cot was delivered shortly afterwards so our son could go to sleep.

The bed was very comfy and we had an excellent rest, disturbed only by our son. Breakfast the next day hit all the spots. The staff were very helpful guiding us to their free shuttle bus which took us close to the Star Ferry. Alternatively we were only a shot walk from a MTR station. We did not realise till afterwards that we could have boarded a bus to Stanley from pretty much outside the hotel.

also a regular coach pick up to the Airport Express Station so no transport problems there.We checked in after a long flight from London and the check in staff were very effficient and friendly.The rooms for Hong Kong were quite a decent size but we had what was possibly the worst view from a hotel room that we have been in it was just a wall that we were looking at.

reviews.text: After packing we headed on down to Tiffany's Bar for a few drinks the drinks were very good and the service excellent but what else would you expect in Hong Kong.The Hotel is very good as a base for exploring Hong Kong or venturing into Mainland China which visas can be arranged from the Tour Desk.If you stay in Kowloon you must visit the ladies market in Mongkok to see every kind of fake imaginable from wallets watches and handbags any kind of designer brand is on sale here from the very good to the not so good but a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours and then a walk down the famous Nathan Road where every type of electronic device is available but be prepared to shop around as every shop seemed to have a different price for everything.Also Hong Kong is very good if you want a made to measure suit one tailor i would very much recommend is Raja Fashions on Cameron Road which is very good value Raja Fashions also tour extensively in the UK and the US so i would check out his website.The Grand Stanford has a very nice swimming pool on the 18 th floor which is very good to relax by.

reviews.text: Large spacious rooms, with the most comfortable beds ever! The pool area was gorgeous. The buffet breakfast was amazing - so much choice that we didn't know where to start! I found the service at this hotel to be absolutely brilliant - the staff could not do enough for us and nothing was too much trouble. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Harbour City and Sogo shopping malls and the ferry terminal. If you don't want to walk there is a free shuttle from the hotel that leaves every half hour to take you to the shops/ferries. The location in Kowloon is lovely, a lot quieter than other places. Be sure to consider this hotel when coming to Hong Kong.

Having just returned from an extensive tour of Asia this was our first port of call. We booked the hotel as part of a deal with Dial a flight ( also excellent) . As this trip was to celebrate our Silver wedding anniversary we up graded to a harbour view room and boy was that a good decision. It was like being in the Penthouse Suite with outstanding views over the iconic harbour. This hotel was the best hotel we have stopped in anywhere in the world, quite simply outstanding. Room and facilities first class and the hotel staff were superb and even provided a complimentary bottle of champagne and a cake to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel is very well located on Moody Road and is very convenient for the MTR ( underground ) which is also very good and a short walk from the harbour front walkway which leads to the Star ferry ( a must ) . We loved Hong Kong and found it to be a lovely mix of the old and modern. In short if you want to stop in HK you will struggle to find a better hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed here a few times on business, nice hotel, have stayed at the Eaton and Royal Garden also. Royal Garden my fave only cos of the fab new refurbished rooms on top floor and amazing roof top pool. But Grand Stanford a fave amongst my colleagues, Western hotel, good brekkie, typical cheesy singers entertaining the guests in Tiffanys Bar in an evening, great foyer for meetings, nice afternoon tea, nice rooftop pool but smaller than the neighbours, comfy bed i slept well (6th floor and above)....

description: InterContinental Grand Stanford Hong Kong was one of the first hotels on the Tsim Sha Tsui East waterfront of Victoria Harbour and still sets the standard for excellence in Hong Kong. As part of the Intercontinental Hotels Group, the five-star hotel is nestled in a quiet corner of the bustling shopping, business and entertainment district of Tsimshatsui East.The hotel is within easy reach of all major transportation systems including the world-famous Star Ferry and MTR. Situated 10 minutes away from the East Tsimshatsui Station and Hung Hom Station, the hotel also offers complimentary shuttle bus service to Nathan Road and major shopping malls along Canton Road within Tsimshatsui area. A prime locale puts you in easy reach of Central, Jade Market, Hong Kong Cultural Centre, Kowloon Park and Hong Kong Science Museum.
